attributes.action: Adjust school rules in the UK to allow toilet use at any time of the day.
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience, local news and student responses, it has come to my attention that this is a significant problem facing students in the UK. While most schools allow students with bladder problems to use the toilet facilities at any time, Students with mild, recently developed or disease-related bladder problems are expected to wait until the end of lesson time, and face punishment if they walk out of class.
attributes.background: Make it a baseline to allow toilet use at any time within school environments, unless a student usually uses the time to slack off. Following significant backlash, this has become a much more prevalent issue locally- I began a local petition and garnered heavy support from around the school.

rejection.details:
Decisions on policies regarding when students can leave the classroom are a matter for individual schools and teachers, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

If you are unhappy with how a school or teacher deals with requests to use the toilet, you should raise this with the school or relevant local authority.
